Name: Brest (Belarus)
Description: Brest [dead link] is a border town in the south-west corner of Belarus, near Terespol in Poland.

Name: Polotsk
Description: Polotsk (or Polatsk)  is a city in Belarus, in Vitebsk Oblast. First mentioned in 862, it is the oldest city in Belarus. Now it is a city of local importance with 82,000 inhabitants and with considerable architectural heritage from the times of old Rus as well as from the later periods.

Name: Gomel
Description: Gomel (Belarusian/Russian: Го́мель; also transliterated as Homel) is the second largest city in Belarus (around 500 000 inhabitants), and is the capital of Gomel Oblast.

Name: Grodno
Description: Grodno  (Belarusian: Hrodna, Russian: Grodno) is a city in Belarus, on the Neman River, close to the borders of Poland and Lithuania (about 20 km and 30 km away respectively).

Name: Mogilev
Description: Mogilev is a city in Mogilev Oblast.

Name: Nesvizh
Description: Nesvizh (Niasviž) is a city in Minsk Province, Belarus.

Name: Vitebsk
Description: Vitebsk or Viciebsk (Belorusian: Віцебск, Russian: Витебск) is the middle of Vitebsk Oblast in Belarus.

Name: Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park
Description: Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park (Belarusian: Белавежская пушча) is in the Brest and Hrodna regions of Belarus.

Name: Mir
Description: Mir is a town in the Kareličy region of Grodno Oblast in Belarus. Prior to the 2nd World War it was known as an international centre of Jewish learning (Mir yeshiva).
